alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Colquitt; Cook; Tift (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cook, Berrien, northeastern Colquitt and southern Tift Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Norman Park, or 11 miles northeast of Moultrie, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nashville, Adel, Sparks, Enigma, Omega, Norman Park, Lenox, Alapaha, Ellenton, Reed Bingham State Park, Eldorado, Massee, Glory, Flat Ford, Wagon Wheel, Weber, Cottle, Cool Spring, Staunton and Berrien Co A/P. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
